steps.description: 1. Detect the vertical green separators (the full-height columns of value “3”). Use them as reference dividers to split the input into equal-width vertical panels. The output width = one panel width and the output height = input height.

2. For each panel independently, find all yellow pixels (value “4”) and compute the minimal bounding box that contains them (if a panel has no yellow, skip it). Keep the box’s vertical position (rows) unchanged but record its leftmost column within the panel.

3. Left‑align each panel’s extracted bounding box: translate the box horizontally so its left edge becomes column 0 of a panel-sized canvas, preserving its row indices (do not change shape or size of pixels).

4. Combine all left‑aligned boxes into one panel-sized output by OR-ing their pixels: output a yellow at a cell if any extracted, left‑aligned box has a yellow there; otherwise leave it background (do not overwrite separators — separators are removed in the final single-panel output).

5. Produce the final grid with the same number of rows as the input and width equal to one panel (the left-aligned, combined panel). Colors: yellow where the OR produced yellow, background (1) elsewhere.
